posts.post_content: The joke deck would work if there was an [R&D's Secret Lair](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=R&D's Secret Lair) in play. And with the Lair in play, Jasconious would count as an Island for his Islandhome ability, as well.

Posted By: izzet_guild_mage (2/9/2010 11:53:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It wasn't a creature with a basic land type; back then the creature type was \*everything\* after the type, even if it was more than one word (for a while, Goblin Wizard wasn't a Goblin, nor a Wizard, but just a Goblin Wizard). This is not the rule anymore, and good riddance.  
  
As for the card itself, this is an unplayable relic of a time when WotC thought big creatures needed huge drawbacks to balance them out, as if the fact that the game would often be over before they could be brought to bear wasn't drawback enough. A 6/8 for 7 mana would have been fair if not on the weak side even without any drawbacks; with them, this card became essentially unplayable.
posts.html:
It wasn't a creature with a basic land type; back then the creature type was *everything* after the type, even if it was more than one word (for a while, Goblin Wizard wasn't a Goblin, nor a Wizard, but just a Goblin Wizard). This is not the rule anymore, and good riddance.

As for the card itself, this is an unplayable relic of a time when WotC thought big creatures needed huge drawbacks to balance them out, as if the fact that the game would often be over before they could be brought to bear wasn't drawback enough. A 6/8 for 7 mana would have been fair if not on the weak side even without any drawbacks; with them, this card became essentially unplayable.

I was pretty young when I first got into Magic, and this was in the first Magic product I ever bought, a Starter Pack (or whatever it was called) of Fourth Edition. I immediately loved this card and thought it was really awesome. It was my favorite card for quite a while.  
  
I was dumb when I was young. Cool art, though.

Posted By: Peaceout734 (10/31/2011 9:16:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Absolutely overcosted. For that cost, I expect something stronger, and with those drawbacks, I expect something cheaper. It wasn't even good for its day. Nobody has fond memories of this card. This card never won any games, and I'd honestly be surprised if it went into any decks- ever.   
  
I don't mean to sound so harsh, but c'mon. It's not like stronger cards weren't already printed for cheaper by this time.
posts.html:

Posted By: azure_drake222222 (1/31/2013 1:49:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Somehow I ave a Revised edition of this card. 7 CMC for a 6/8 that you must pay 3 to untap, doesn't untap during your untap phase, can't attack unless your opponent controls islands, and is buried when you control no islands.  
  
That is just crappy all around.  
  
Maybe you can make it SEMI USABLE using something like [Magical Hack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magical Hack) to change the land type required in the card text, but even then it seems more trouble than its worth.
posts.html:
